page.title: 04HOUSING IN DACRE.
page.content: Most houses in Dacre date to the early 18th century.One of the oldest was built in 1714 and the newest house built in 1977.Most of the houses are made from stone but the later ones are brick built.There are examples of whitewashed village house and the farm homes tend to be whitewashed too.The roofs on the houses are all slate apart from the castle because the castle roof was made from zinc. The windows reflect the variety of the stone and whitewashed cottages the older buildings preserving their style with small square windows with lots of glazing bars.One large home,Dacre Lodge 1830 home of the Washington family is of Austrian design.This is a typical estate lodge with large gardens,croquet lawn and surrounding woodland with a long drive.The public house 1749 was originally three houses
